CONJUGATES: zippers (n. pl.) | zippers (v. pres. 3rd sg.) | zippering (v. pres. part.) | zippered (v. past/p.p.)
ETYMOLOGY: From the verb 'zip' (an onomatopoeic word suggesting speed and sound) + the suffix '-er'. Popularized in the 1920s by B.F. Goodrich to describe the sound of the fastener closing.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A device consisting of two flexible strips of material with interlocking teeth and a sliding piece, used to fasten or close two edges of fabric or material.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种由两排可互相啮合的齿状物和一块滑动件组成的装置，用于连接或关闭两块布料或材料的边缘。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The zipper on my backpack broke, and now I can't close the main compartment.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我背包上的拉链坏了，现在主隔层关不上了。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To fasten, close, or secure something using a zipper.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 用拉链拉上或拉开某物。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She quickly zippered her luggage before heading to the airport.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她迅速拉上行李箱的拉链，然后前往机场。
